summary: Bachelor student with an ever-present passion in and dedication to sustainability in all its aspects. Professionally,  my main ambition is to substantially integrate socially and environmentally responsible development into the corporate world, and therefore into people’s lives. As I aspire to achieve this through creativity and innovation, I started a bachelor in Economics & International Business. I am entrepreneurial, have a very hands-on mentality and am fascinated by the psychological dimension of marketing and management and strive to advance my research in this area. When facing let downs, persevering and staying confident till the end are key to my work ethics. Eager to learn and disciplined to handle great amounts of responsibility with minimum guidance and supervision is a courtesy of the problem based learning (PBL) system and the emphasis on independent, critical thinking at Maastricht University, for which I am immeasurably grateful. My mixed Russian-Arabian origin and subsequent assimilation into Western society enables me to familiarize and orientate in a multitude of distinctive cultural settings. I am interested in positions in sustainability consultancy, green banking and the creative industry. Through working with different sustainable student associations of Maastricht University such as Enactus and VSA, I gained many valuable skills such as working collaboratively in a proactive and independent way, project management and deep analysis of social media trends. Now being in my third and last year of the Economics and Business Bachelor in Maastricht, I am in search of an internship that will offer opportunities to expand my knowledge on sustainability and business.

school.name: Maastricht University School of Business and Economics
Maastricht University School of Business and Economics

volunteer_experiences.description:
Internship 
Innovative and creative showcase platform for emerging designers, where I was able to gain the following experience: 
•Integration of sustainability principles into design – we selected the most eco-friendly material in fashion pieces, used almost solely thrifted baseline pieces, worked on minimizing the materials used and on upcycling approaches.  
•Task management under severe time pressure – I was responsible for constant check-ups on clothes, designers and models (i.e. sewing, replacing fabrics, support before the Fashion Show).
•Collaboration with a wide range of designers, project management and other assistants to successfully implement all planned activities.

Co-developed, organized and executed ecologically sustainable projects for the Green Office of UM, such as:  
• The Waste Management Project and Water Management Project: equipped every single university campus with elaborate recycling facilities and water fountains with a large-scale promotion campaign surrounding the installation 
• The Desertification Workshop series: engaged university students and United World College students in a set of educational activities on the challenges of – and potential solutions for – the global desertification problem 
• The Employee-Student Carbon Footprint Series: developed a clear set of alternatives to compensate the carbon emissions generated by university staff during work-related travel

Responsible in assisting financial, legislative and project-based matters. 
• Arbor project: involved in filming the production process of eco-friendly notebooks & on-going search for additional supply sources of production materials, such as carton and paper                                                                                          • Produce monthly finance reports, maintain the balance sheet for each individual project and event                                           • Help recheck all incoming and outgoing payments                                                                                                                           • Organize necessary venue bookings and transportation for the monthly board meeting                                                              • Promotion of Enactus at the 2019 INKOM                                                                                                                                 • Investigate and source sponsorship opportunities                                                                                                                         • Handling important sponsor and partner correspondence

In 2018 I was accepted for a project management position by Young Office, the youth department of the Bonnefanten Museum in Maastricht. I dare to say that this was the most fulfilling and educational position I took. We organized a whole myriad of interactive events with a small group of 7. My main responsibility lied in the “marketing department”, as I had to constantly think of how to attract more (younger) visitors to the cultural enrichment the museum offers. Throughout this time, I was able to work on several critical skills, most notably: 
• Teamwork and brainstorming for a wide range of cultural projects                                                                                            

•Organization, such as organising a stance at Pink Pop Festival and Museum Night Maastricht. The latter is a yearly Art Night programme at the Bonnefanten museum; we planned and managed art exhibitions and workshops for people visiting. This brought great awareness to Young Office as part of the Maastricht Museum culture.        
                                                                                                                                                                               • Marketing, particularly through near-constant PR for external parties, storytelling and engagement via events at the University Maastricht campus, and management of social media accounts.

• Organisational skills: (online) events with famous guest speakers such as Christopher Sebastian McJetters, seasonal potlucks at Landbouwbelang in Maastricht and workshops to help students integrate into veganism and introduce them to more sustainable living overall        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       • VSA was still new at the time: responsible for building an inclusive community and recruiting more people so VSA in Maastricht can also be registered as a student association                              
• Responsible for social media (mainly Instagram and Facebook) engagement & posting about the vegan lifestyle as a student of UM, helping with Logo design
